Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more in imagination than in reality.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: If a man knows not which port he sails, no wind is favorable.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: No person has the power to have everything they want, but it is in their power not to want what they don’t have, and to cheerfully put to good use what they do have.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: Nothing, to my way of thinking, is a better proof of a well ordered mind than a man’s ability to stop just where he is and pass some time in his own company.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: He who fears death will never do anything worth of a man who is alive.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: This is our big mistake: to think we look forward to death. Most of death is already gone. Whatever time has passed is owned by death.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: Life is very short and anxious for those who forget the past, neglect the present, and fear the future.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: I judge you unfortunate because you have never lived through misfortune. You have passed through life without an opponent—no one can ever know what you are capable of, not even you.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: While we are postponing, life speeds by.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: Consider, when you are enraged at any one, what you would probably think if he should die during the dispute.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: What difference does it make how much you have? What you do not have amounts to much more.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: A man is as miserable as he thinks he is.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare, it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: The less we deserve good fortune, the more we hope for it.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: We should give as we would receive, cheerfully, quickly, and without hesitation; for there is no grace in a benefit that sticks to the fingers.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: When we are well, we all have good advice for those who are ill.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: Love in its essence is spiritual fire.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: Be wary of the man who urges an action in which he himself incurs no risk.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: The bravest sight in the world is to see a great man struggling against adversity.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: He who is brave is free.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: Shun no toil to make yourself remarkable by some talent or other; yet do not devote yourself to one branch exclusively.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: There is nothing in the world so much admired as a man who knows how to bear unhappiness with courage.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: There are more things to alarm us than to harm us, and we suffer more often in apprehension than reality.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: We often want one thing and pray for another, not telling the truth even to the gods.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: Brave men rejoice in adversity, just as brave soldiers triumph in war.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: No untroubled day has ever dawned for me.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: The mind that is anxious about the future is miserable.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: Life is warfare.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: The wish for healing has always been half of health.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: If thou art a man, admire those who attempt great things, even though they fail.

Quotes.Author: Seneca
Quotes.Quote: No one is laughable who laughs at himself.
